attributes.action: Make schools provide more support for left handed children learning to write
attributes.background: Schools are equipped for right handed children. Items such as workbooks are not helpful. At such an important time in their development, not having specific support can knock their confidence. For example work books set out so that their writing hand is not covering the words they are copying.
attributes.additional_details: I have two left handed children and a left handed brother.  They struggle to use simple things because they live in a right handed world.

attributes.action: Give 100% tax relief on pensions when care home costs exceed the pension income.
attributes.background: My elderly mother-in-law has Alzheimers Dementia and lives in a care home. Total pension income is around £16K PA.  Total care home costs are £33K and rising.  Why is it necessary to pay several thousand pounds income tax which erodes the reserves faster and will lead to her needing government help?
attributes.additional_details: There was a plan to cap the care costs but that has now been scrapped.  In any case it was not a true and honest capping but a sneaky way to make political capital out of addressing care costs without actually spending any money.  It would have benefited only a tiny minority. To allow large corporates to pay paltry amounts of tax whilst levying income tax on pensions paid to paupers is morally and ethically wrong and we should address this totally unjust state of affairs.

attributes.action: Give the UK a Dutch style referendum vote on the Ukraine joining the EU.
attributes.background: The Dutch people have just been robbed by the EU officials, by having a 64% vote against the Ukraine joining, being completely ignored. Brussels have said that the Ukraine deserve to join as they have met their targets and so the Dutch people are incorrect in thier view and opinion.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: bikers with a CBT dont have to ride with L plates after 2 years on the road
attributes.background: riding with L plates and riding without any L plates make no difference on a bike all they do is keep breaking off and left laying on the road making it a hazard
attributes.additional_details:
L plate left laying on the road is a hazard , it is a danger to other bikers it could pop a Tyre and cause serious body damage or even death 

it also can be just as dangerous to car drivers or buses/lorry's as if they cant control a blow out they could end up going in to a head on crash or in to a pedestrian walking on the pavement 

can also be a danger if a vehicle drives over  a L plate it could be brought up in the air and his a vehicle following behind

attributes.action: Stop sales of arms to Saudi Arabia until there are no human rights concerns
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has bought 1000's of missiles and bombs in recent years and more contracts for arms have been approved. British made weapons may now be in use in the conflict in Yemen. Saudi is on the list of countries the British Foreign office thinks are of human rights concern.

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Binding quota of gender representation in all public & government offices
attributes.background: Currently the male and female population are not equally presented in UK public & government offices. The UK is ranked 49th in the world with regards to the number of women in national parliaments.  Norway implements a binding quota: each gender is represented by a minimum of 40% of members.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 UK General Election: men made up 71% of MPs; 74% of Members of House of Lords; 68% of elected councillors; 87% of local authority council leaders.  Women make up 43% of Labour MPs, 21% of Conservative MPs, 36% of SNP MPs, 13% of elected mayors. While the majority of medical students are female and 80% of NHS staff are women, women make up just 28% of trust chairs. We need binding quotas, the appropriate framework & effective sanctions for noncompliance. Lets implement binding quotas.

attributes.action: change the law of dogs on public footpaths and open land to no dogs allowed.
attributes.background: due to increasing livestock attacks due to dogs and a outdated law which can never be enforced if the police have no evidence then no action can be taken against the owners of the dog if they can be found...which in turn causes tens of thousands of damage to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: its a well known fact the British news media does not report the real accounts of how many dog attacks there is on livestock / wildlife, but on other media sites it's widespread ..farming forums farming press you tube  etc ...but not everyone reads this media ..this law needs rewritten to which if there is no  written permission given for dogs allowed on a public path /open land then no dogs allowed ..

attributes.action: Commit to improve transgender healthcare in the UK
attributes.background:
In July 2016, I polled 100 transgender people and 60% reported their experience at a gender identity clinic (GIC) was detrimental to their mental health. 

The process of proving the validity of your gender in order to receive treatment harms individuals and it must be changed.
attributes.additional_details:
Full survey found on Beyond the Binary. While GICs are currently working towards reducing waiting times, the entire process is broken.

By signing this petition, we are asking the government to:

- Pledge more funds towards trans health care to address admin problems.
- Prioritise the work of the Equalities Office to address the harm that GICs are doing.
- Anything else that can be done to address the lack of NICE guidelines for treating gender dysphoria and means of treatment.

attributes.action: Make care for teenagers/young adults with disabilities free for working parents.
attributes.background: As a continually working parent of a child with a disability, it is impossible to find child care for my son either reasonably priced or even available. Unless I have a family member to look after my son outwith school hours I cannot work. Let's make this care available and free for working parents.

attributes.action: Make Ebooks (Kindle, etc) free from VAT.
attributes.background: Books are zero rated in UK for VAT because of their cultural and educational value. However, Ebooks (e.g. those delivered to Kindle etc) are not, but are hit by 20% VAT. Given that 'virtual' books do not require  destruction of forests, printing and distribution this is clearly unfair. Zero rate now

attributes.action: Fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse
attributes.background: Calling on the Government to fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse as they fund mothers and the child which is brilliant but the fathers suffer too and this is totally unfair considering the amount of hurt and suffering fathers go through too.
attributes.additional_details: This has affected my family and it really hurts is that I cannot get counselling unless I "PAY" which the child and the mother gets it funded, we are in 2016 and this is totally unfair and needs changing.

attributes.action: Ban the breeding and sale of Pugs, Bulldogs and Shar Peis in the UK
attributes.background: These breeds of dogs have many health problems and is unfair that they have to live like this. Therefore it should be illegal to breed or purchase these dogs.

attributes.action: Reduce the payment of stamp duty to 0% for British Armed Forces personnel
attributes.background:
Armed Forces personnel, by virtue of work, are likely to move around more as a result of posting. Moving home every 2-3 years can be
costly incurring legal fees and tax. To reduce this cost, incured as a result of the employment, stamp duty could be reduced to 0% for residential property purchase
attributes.additional_details: With my current property 2 years on the market at a price below market value and still unable to sell. When I return from serving overseas I will incur 3% stamp duty to buy a new home close to where I work. I face this, paying full rent for a property or living in a single man room where I have little choice over food and little privacy, Im 43 I dont wish to live like a student, I would like to afford my own space.

attributes.action: Do not open a UK trade hub in any state that discriminates against LGBT+ people
attributes.background: The Department for International Trade, led by Dr Liam Fox who has the worst LGBT+ voting record of any cabinet member, intends to open a UK trade hub in Raleigh, North Carolina. This is despite the fact that the state's HB2 permits businesses to directly discriminate against the LGBT+ community.
attributes.additional_details:
HMG should join Paypal, HP, Deutsche Bank and others in refusing to support North Carolina until HB2 is repealed.

The DfIT has a duty not to send its LGBT+ staff, contractors and their families to states which treat them as second class citizens in a climate of fear and prejudice.

HMG has a duty to the global LGBT+ community to send a clear signal, even to our allies, that this discrimination is totally unacceptable. HMG must stand up for those struggling against injustice everywhere.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Aiming High for Young People' Plan
attributes.background: The 'Aiming High for Young People Plan' provides young people with funding and comfort, as well as an escape for troubled kids. Without the appropriate places for young people to stay off the streets, crime has statistically increased in these areas.
attributes.additional_details: By next year, the government will stop providing a place of comfort for young people in every consistentuency, the government will stop providing £25 million for teenagers in disadvantaged communities, and the government will stop providing young people influence over local authority funding. This needs to be changed. We, as gatekeepers for the next generation, must make sure the youth develop with the optimum funding and appreciation. The futures of millions of children holds in the balance.

attributes.action: Say no to the single market and 7 year immigration brake, leave means leave.
attributes.background: Brexit, leave means leave say no to the single market and say no to the 7 year immigration brake, after 7 years we would be back to square one.

attributes.action: Immediate management of Seagull numbers in South West England.
attributes.background: I live with my family in a seaside town called Budleigh Salterton, Devon and was recently attacked by a seagull while out with my newborn son who was in his pram at the time. The seagulls steal food, scare tourists, create mess and damage cars

attributes.action: Review and Change the Assesment process for PIP & ESA
attributes.background: Due to the unprecedented amount of Personal Independent Payment (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) claims that are being overturned at Mandatory Reconsideration (MR) and Tribunal, we  demand that the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP), review and change the assessment system.
attributes.additional_details:
1.To stop using Atos/Capita assessors
2.All initial assessments to be carried out by the claimants local GP 
3.ALL assessors to be medically competent with the conditions they are assessing
4.ALL assessment’s to be recorded as a matter of course
6.Copies of all assessment reports to be sent to claimants 
7.Assessors to be penalised if reports untruthful
8.If a claimant goes through the process and awarded by the Court of Tribunal. The DWP should not withhold payment because of appeal.

attributes.action: Changes to Protect 'Asthma' Sufferers from Smoke from Garden Fires, Clean Air.
attributes.background: Asthma sufferers need protecting from Smoke from Garden Fires in Law, in this day and age with Air pollution it can be a Killer for not only these but anyone who has a Lung and Breathing issue, Clean Air act does Not Protect these people at this time, they have a right to live and breath.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government talks on so called Clean Air but have Failed to look into these people and Protect them in Law, very wrong and selfish on their part as you have to have the issue to know, also Hay Fever another Lung issue from the same.

There are Recycling outlets to stop this and Must be used by All and Not the Few, Fires also cause issues with Wildlife and Nesting Birds which are Declining at a large rate.

Common sense must Prevail.

attributes.action: Make killing a cat or dog with a vehicle a criminal offence
attributes.background:
On Friday 13th of May my life was forever changed.
My much loved cat was run over and killed outside my house. I was on my way to work when my neighbour called to break the news. I had to come home and take my cat to be cremated the same day and was off work for a week as a result with stress.
attributes.additional_details: I reviewed my CCTV footage and can see only one car drive down my road from when the cat goes over the fence until someone clearly picks him up and places him on the pavement. the car in question can't be positively identified but was going at some speed and made no attempt to swerve, slow down or stop after the event. This attitude that family pets are not important enough to make a law to protect has bred this type of attitude and I for one think this is wrong and needs addressing

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Prior to any referendum a government inquiry be held on consequences either way.
attributes.background: Subsequent to the EU referendum committee hearings have been held revealing consequences, effects and subsequent necessary actions and criticism has been made of the claims made by campaigners, such information is useful to lawmakers and to voters. Rules for such campaigns/ campaigners are required.

attributes.action: Bring back retrospective death penalty for murderers and paedophiles
attributes.background: I am a British citizen. And am fed up with the way we have to pay for scumbags to "enjoy their captivity"

attributes.action: Article 50 Lisbon treaty can only be invoked by 2/3 's majority of MP's
attributes.background:
The recent referendum showed different needs across the UK. 
As a parliamentary democracy we trust in elected MP's to make decisions on our behalf. 
Only a plan that a significant majority of MP's can support will re-unite the UK
attributes.additional_details:
There is currently no plan. It is the job of parliament  to ensure 
that before article 50 is invoked there is robust, coherent and competent plan in place that is in the interests of the UK as a whole and will deliver clear advantages and benefits to the UK over the current status quo as a member of the European Union.

attributes.action: Make finance a part of the GCSE Maths curriculum.
attributes.background: Children are leaving school into a world they are not aware of financially. Too many young people are taking out Loans and Credit Cards without fully understanding how that will affect them later in life. Make finance a part of GCSE maths and teach students about loans, mortgages and credit cards
attributes.additional_details: I took out a £5000 loan when I was 18. I was in then in a job that enabled me to repay the debt comfortably. Since then I lost that job and have been financially crippled since then. I can no longer get a mobile phone contract, I find it hard to get a private tenancy agreement. None of this or the consequences was I informed of during school. Make information about loans, credit cards and mortgages compulsory in GCSE maths to better equip students for the real world.

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: Reinstate A&E, renovate, modernise and expand High Wycombe General Hospital.
attributes.background: High Wycombe is a busy market town and hub for London commuters. As a newer college town its growing population has increased medical needs. Its Accident and Emergency Services were relocated to Stoke Mandeville, Bucks, which is 15.7m away (27 mins via the A413), or 13.2m (26 mins via Hampden Rd).
attributes.additional_details: Lives are jeopardised by transit times along country roads which are unsuitable for the task and make overtaking ambulances a traffic hazard. There is inadequate infrastructure to service the population, and that of neighbouring towns for whom Wycombe provided a closer A&E option. This petition calls upon the NHS, Wycombe District Council and Wycombe MP Steve Baker to renovate, modernise and expand the General Hospital in Wycombe, and reinstate Wycombe A&E as a flagship for the NHS in Bucks.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: We the people of Britain demand more funds to strengthen the NHS.
attributes.background:
As we know the wonderful NHS is failing the people of Britain due to big"cuts" and we stress that more cuts will end the NHS and certainly lead to a weaker and unhealthy Britain. 
I call on the government to put more effort and funds into the NHS to strengthen its weakness. Who is with me on this.
attributes.additional_details: Online researchers have carried out a questionnaire on the failure of the NHS the outcome is shameful, Also the amount of hospitals closing in Britain is dreadful this is due to "Cuts" and lack of funds, and the taxpayers pay in to receive a good strong Heath system. It's time to strengthen are NHS and fast, we the people of Britain demand more funding NOW! Number of deaths that occurred under the  conservative government is very high.

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Can you please just raise the speed limit to 80 as 70 is ancient.
attributes.background: I want this petition to go forward as I can not see the point of a 70mph speed limit when on the motorway it feels dangerous as cars fly past well over that and I do not want to break the law to maintain a safe flow of traffic .there is no money for better policing and you cannot fine everybody
attributes.additional_details: Other countries as Czech Republic Romania and Germany all have higher speed limits and this would lower intimidating driving

attributes.action: Keep the UK in the single market and continue to allow free movement of people
attributes.background:
On 23 June 2016 the people of the UK decided that European integration had gone too far.

However we believe that the UK must continue to be part of the single market and continue to allow free movement of people.
attributes.additional_details:
The single market has obviously benefitted the UK economically. Freedom of movement, one of the four freedoms of the single market, is also a basic human right.

Immigration to the UK has had a positive effect on our country. Keeping the borders open means people can continue to work and contribute in this great country and make it even better. And the people of the UK can continue to travel and contribute in the rest of Europe.

attributes.action: England (w/o London) and Wales become independent and get only them out of EU
attributes.background: In the wake of the Brexit referendum results there are different calls for the breakup of UK. An alternative solution to satisfy the voters, keep UK whole and partially within EU would be to devolve England (w/o London) and Wales and let them leave EU (like Crown dependencies currently are).

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: Teach Current Affairs in schools and promote learning about the world
attributes.background: It is vital that the people we depend on to be our future have unbiased access to what is going on in this world. Citizenship focuses on 'British values'... We can teach kids to grow up thinking for themselves
attributes.additional_details:
The Citizenship foundation's website explains that citizenship is taught in schools as an 'ideal tool for exploring British values.'
However we should be exploring world values, world affairs that are happening right now. 
History is very important but how can we depend on the 'generation of the future' to build a better world if they are not learning about the world now.
We need to promote decision making based on free and open thinking

http://www.citizenshipfoundation.org.uk/main/page.php?286

attributes.action: Make food producers include corn/additives derived from corn in allergens info
attributes.background: I'm 51 with multiple food allergies. Corn allergy can cause reactions ranging from anaphylaxis to headaches and stomach problems. A list of things to avoid is 4 sheets of A4 paper long. In order to shop/eat I need to carry it with me. Life with corn allergy is difficult but could be so much easier.

attributes.action:
In, out, or Sort it out?

Add a change the EU option to the referendum ballot.
attributes.background: The in out EU referendum is not providing the British people with the choice the majority wish to make. Life is not black or white it is grey. By far the majority of voters would, given the choice send a message of protest to the EU demanding reform.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'stay' and 'leave' camps both identify what is wrong with Europe, neither provide a clear vision, or model or plan to optimise Britain's relationship with it.

There is an overwhelming majority for change. The EU needs to hear the clear voice of Btritain.

attributes.action: Stop UK Gap Year travel companies placing volunteers in orphanages abroad.
attributes.background:
1. 80% of children in homes in Asia and Africa are NOT orphans.
2. Short-term volunteers disrupt the welfare of the children.
3. It is illegal in many countries to volunteer on a Visitor's Visa.
4. Many orphanages force children to convert from their family religion in return support.
attributes.additional_details:
These conditions violate the terms of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child to a home, family, community, religion.
http://www.nextgenerationnepal.org/File/The-Paradox-of-Orphanage-Volunteering.pdf
http://globalsl.org/why-unicef-and-save-the-children-are-against-you-caring-for-orphans/
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/02/cambodia-child-protection-workers-call-for-end-to-booming-orphanage-tourism
http://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/may/16/volunteers-stop-visiting-orphanages-start-preserving-families

attributes.action: Stop Social Services Early Intervention/unnecessary Adoption threats
attributes.background: That the Social Services are using Early Intervention even when not necessary to instigate threats of Adoption so as to meet internal quotas as set up by Ofsted and the Adoption Agencies
attributes.additional_details:
The case of Pauline Goodwin June 2005 Mother approached whilst in Hospital having just given birth, then 3 days later given court order to leave the child in the care of said hospital,.

Some critics state there are financial incentives for Local Authorities to secure adoptions, due to increased funding for social services units that effectively place a greater number of children with adopted families

attributes.action: Make London the test city for medical/recreational marijuana
attributes.background:
Create a legal market for marijuana in the UK. With the goal of taking money out of crinmals hands, collecting tax to be used in the health and education sector and to get access to an organic substance that is safer than alcohol.
Age Limit - 20+
Possession for personal consumption - 2 Ounces

attributes.action: To Make Breast Ironing a Criminal Offence
attributes.background: Ritual involves young girls having their breasts beaten, burnt and massaged in order to stop them developing.

attributes.action: Put a statue of Diane Abbott MP in the Palace of Westminster's Central Lobby.
attributes.background:
A full sized bronze statue should be commissioned and placed in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster to honour Diane Abbott MP.
As the first black woman to have a seat in the House of Commons and a faithful public servant she is an inspiration to us all; astonishingly resilient and brave.

attributes.action: legislate to pay travel time from home as paid work to first job and last
attributes.background: Time spent travelling to and from first and last jobs by workers who do not have a fixed office should be regarded as work and should go on time sheet as paid work as workers are being stopped 10 hours per week
attributes.additional_details: the European Court of Justice judgement ruled those without a fixed or habitual office should consider the time they spend travelling between their homes and the premises of their first and last jobs as part of their hours for the day

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Put cameras on Humber Bridge to catch speeders, tailgaters & poor drivers
attributes.background: The bridge is often closed for hours on end because theres been an accident caused by someones poor driving. The speed limit is 50, but drivers often go upwards of 60. The drivers are inches away from other car bumpers, trying to intimidate the other cars into going faster than the 50 limit
attributes.additional_details: There are cameras at the booths. These have witnessed road rage incidents, & drivers going through the tag lane above 50 (the limit at the booths is 30)
